dialogue:
PersonA: Hi Tom, are you busy tomorrow’s afternoon?
PersonB: I’m pretty sure I am. What’s up?
PersonA: Can you go with me to the animal shelter?.
PersonB: What do you want to do?
PersonA: I want to get a puppy for my son.
PersonB: That will make him so happy.
PersonA: Yeah, we’ve discussed it many times. I think he’s ready now.
PersonB: That’s good. Raising a dog is a tough issue. Like having a baby ;-) 
PersonA: I'll get him one of those little dogs.
PersonB: One that won't grow up too big;-)
PersonA: And eat too much;-))
PersonB: Do you know which one he would like?
PersonA: Oh, yes, I took him there last Monday. He showed me one that he really liked.
PersonB: I bet you had to drag him away.
PersonA: He wanted to take it home right away ;-).
PersonB: I wonder what he'll name it.
PersonA: He said he’d name it after his dead hamster – Lemmy  - he's  a great Motorhead fan :-)))

PersonB: I’ve just fallen in love with this advent calendar! Awesome! I wanna one for my kids!
PersonC: I used to get one every year as a child! Loved them! 
PersonB: Yeah, i remember! they were filled with chocolates!
PersonA: they are different these days! much more sophisticated! Haha!
PersonC: yeah, they can be fabric/ wooden, shop bought/ homemade, filled with various stuff
PersonB: what do you fit inside?
PersonA: small toys, Christmas decorations, creative stuff, hair bands & clips, stickers, pencils & rubbers, small puzzles, sweets
PersonB: WOW! That’s brill! X
PersonA: i add one more very special thing as well- little notes asking my children to do something nice for someone else
PersonC: i like that! My sister adds notes asking her kids questions about christmas such as What did the 3 wise men bring? etc
PersonA: i reckon it prepares them for Christmas 
PersonB: and makes it more about traditions and being kind to other people
PersonA: my children get very excited every time they get one!
PersonB: i can see why! :)

Vegano PersonA: Hello, how may I help you today?

PersonA: Howdy, how y'all doin'?
PersonB: Is that a Texan drawl, girl?
PersonA: Yes ma'am! Loving it out here!
PersonB: How's the job going? Kids behaving themselves?
PersonA: Mostly! They laugh at my accent though!
PersonB: Well, they probably haven't met a Welsh person before!
PersonA: No shit! They ask me to repeat everything! Best one is "Water", course, it's mostly "Waarderr" here! 
PersonB: LOL. I'd love to hear that, you picked up the accent yet?
PersonA: Nah, 21 years in Cardiff isn't easily removed! 
PersonB: We're missing you here, the pub is quiet these days without your laugh!
PersonA: Miss you too! I'm coming home in 6 weeks, though. Last fortnight I'm going travelling with 3 other Brits working here, a Geordie girl, a guy from Belfast and Annie, who's from Glasgow.
PersonB: My God, I'm so jealous! I bet they had even more trouble being understood out there! See you after your trip!

PersonB: and second, you only get the income for the resources you own (tokens on top) and not for everything you have access to
PersonD: the map had full symbol drawn for the action so I also thought it was permanent influence
PersonD: had no idea about the second one
PersonC: the second rule means money would be much more sparse

PersonB: with the rules we played with there was no sense in doing that
PersonC: true
PersonC: yet another game we need to play again with the right rules ;)
PersonB: additionally during the vote phase, if there is a draw the first decision is taken by the player with the least amount of points and not the closest to the player initiating the vote
PersonD: makes sense
PersonD: but I'm not sure about the income phase, it's written that you get income for import
PersonA: well yes but technically the import action is building your own buildings
PersonB: so no matter how you look at it with import you'll always be on top with your token and get the income

PersonA: I'm good thank you just sleepy haha :) how about you?
PersonA: How's things going with studying
PersonB: Oh dear :P What have you been up to? ;) I'm not that sleepy, even though I did get to bed late :P
PersonB: Uni's hard work (no changes there), but I really like my subjects this semester - on of my subjects is Microbiology (so all on bacteria), another is on the Biochemical Pathways to Metabolic Illnesses (basically diabetes and obesity) - so, pretty cool stuff :D
PersonB: WHat about you? Are you having fun?
PersonA: Sounds interesting I've gotta say. Particularly the bacteria stuff! I've been on a walk today so quite tired from that. And I'm enjoying uni yeah! Very very busy. Starting dissertation stuff soon and had a lot of work for essays
PersonB: Did you take any photos whilst on your walk? :D So... what does your dissertation stuff look like? Are you in any Uni groups?
PersonA: Got some yeah :) posted one to Facebook. Mine is looking like geography and politics related. Not sure about uni groups? What's your dissertation on if you have to do one?
PersonB: We don't really have dissertations... at the end of my third year I'll be writing my degree, so that will be like a slightly longer lab report :) Geography and politics - hmmm... that's  a pretty wide topic, I mean, you could talk about Global warming etc. right?
PersonA: Aah ok. So the long report is a big part of your degree and counts a lot towards it?
PersonA: And it's very wide the topic. Can talk about that yes, can also do social and cultural stuff too in there
PersonB: Yeah, basically my grades and my report make up my degree :) Social and cultural stuff... like what?
PersonA: Aaah cool :D I have exams too which make mine up haha. Lucky you
PersonA: And stuff like social separation and classes and how everything plays into each other and culture is like heritage and what matters to different people
PersonB: I meant grades from exams, so I don't know if I'm really that lucky :P That's actually really interesting! So how do you prepare for this? Do you get to interview people?
PersonA: Oh right haha. And I have to do loads of reading and prepare some fieldwork. And I likely will have to inerview people yeah. What kind of things do you do in the lab?
PersonB: Depends on your field of study - I'm doing Embriology, so I basically conduct experiments on mouse oocytes that should hopefully give some decent results. But other people can grow bacteria on petri dishes if they're doing Microbiology, or study particular fragments of DNA if they're doing Genetics
PersonB: It really depends on what you're studying - Biology has a pretty large spectrum, afterall :)

PersonA: How are you? Any new development about the house?
PersonB: Hello my dear!  Sadly not. No news at all regarding the house :(( We'll be sitting on it till the end of our lives!
PersonA: That can't be. It is such a fantastic property. In such an incredibly beautiful estate. It's a matter of time.
PersonB: That's what we thought last spring when we put it on the market.
PersonA: It took me 2 years to sell my flat back in Poland.
PersonB: Oh well... Wait and see. The last prospective buyers we had, 5 weeks back, were so enthusiastic we'd thought we're done. They said ours was shortlisted, their favourite in Ballito, but they still wanted to check another estate. And that was it. She didn't even bother to phone, just sent me a minimal message. Bill got so frustrated that he drank himself stiff that night.
PersonA: He does it from time to time, doesn't he?
PersonB: From time to time? Regularly!!! Can't you remember?!
PersonA: Not quite. Never saw him really tight.
PersonB: Cause you used to leave before his evening was over. I'm seriously worried about his health, to tell you the truth. It's just every day that he tipples.
PersonA: As if slowly killing himself with liquor.
PersonB: He doesn't care. He says he's got his life behind him.
PersonA: But it is terrible. How can you cope with it?
PersonB: I stopped to care too. It is his life. If he wants to put a quicker end to it, it's up to him. Look I cannot do anything about it. What hide bottles? Just don't want to have an invalid in my house one day.
PersonA: Therapy?
PersonB: Gimme a break! Can you imagine Bill attending an AA therapy like a good boy! I can't.
PersonA: Nor can I.
PersonB: We even stopped talking about his drinking problem long ago. When he started, just after and because of his early retirement, I thought I'd better refrain from commenting because he's so depressed. But then it was worse and worse... Now it's too late.
PersonA: Poor Luisa, poor Bill. It is so sad. But you are tough Luisa. You are so incredibly tough and strong and even-tempered, I'd say.
PersonB: Yes, I am. That keeps me sane. I don't worry if I can't change it. To a degree...
PersonA: Right you are! "The beach scape changes every month as tides bring in tons of sand and cover the rocks making the beach appear totally different." Do you remember?
